title: Ticket #4998: condor_shadow segfaults on exit
description:
I noticed that the condor_shadow is starting to segfault on exit on some setups.

This happens when the C++ finalizers are being run and a loadable library is used that links against libcondor_utils.so

I think some global is getting deleted twice - once when done when libcondor_utils.so is unloaded, and once again when the static version of the same symbol is being destroyed. That only makes 'kinda sense'; haven't found a smoking gun.

For example, from valgrind: 

==12529== Invalid read of size 8
==12529==    at 0x1F7207: StringList::clearAll() (list.h:503)
==12529==    by 0x1F798A: StringList::~StringList() (string_list.cpp:147)

==12529==    by 0x288344: __wrap_exit (daemon_core.cpp:5238)
==12529==    by 0x2ADDB8: DC_Exit(int, char const*) (daemon_core_main.cpp:359)
==12529==    by 0x1A8925: BaseShadow::holdJobAndExit(char const*, int, int) (baseshadow.cpp:439)
==12529==    by 0x1BE02D: pseudo_ulog(compat_classad::ClassAd*) (pseudo_ops.cpp:549)
==12529==    by 0x1B6AD0: do_REMOTE_syscall() (NTreceivers.cpp:832)
==12529==    by 0x1C231D: RemoteResource::handleSysCalls(Stream*) (remoteresource.cpp:798)
==12529==    by 0x29BD10: DaemonCore::CallSocketHandler_worker(int, bool, Stream*) (daemon_core.cpp:3925)
==12529==    by 0x29BE9C: DaemonCore::CallSocketHandler_worker_demarshall(void*) (daemon_core.cpp:3884)
==12529==    by 0x22A40F: CondorThreads::pool_add(void (*)(void*), void*, int*, char const*) (condor_threads.cpp:1106)
==12529==  Address 0x7d78cb0 is 0 bytes inside a block of size 24 free'd
==12529==    at 0x4A05FD6: operator delete(void*) (vg_replace_malloc.c:480)
==12529==    by 0x7019B21: exit (exit.c:78)
==12529==    by 0x288344: __wrap_exit (daemon_core.cpp:5238)
==12529==    by 0x2ADDB8: DC_Exit(int, char const*) (daemon_core_main.cpp:359)
==12529==    by 0x1A8925: BaseShadow::holdJobAndExit(char const*, int, int) (baseshadow.cpp:439)
==12529==    by 0x1BE02D: pseudo_ulog(compat_classad::ClassAd*) (pseudo_ops.cpp:549)
==12529==    by 0x1B6AD0: do_REMOTE_syscall() (NTreceivers.cpp:832)
==12529==    by 0x1C231D: RemoteResource::handleSysCalls(Stream*) (remoteresource.cpp:798)
==12529==    by 0x29BD10: DaemonCore::CallSocketHandler_worker(int, bool, Stream*) (daemon_core.cpp:3925)

==12529==    by 0x22A40F: CondorThreads::pool_add(void (*)(void*), void*, int*, char const*) (condor_threads.cpp:1106)
==12529==    by 0x295856: DaemonCore::CallSocketHandler(int&, bool) (daemon_core.cpp:3872)

I haven't figured out what symbol this is (FWIW - there's about 8 different global symbols that are freed twice according to valgrind. This includes std::strings - meaning we can't hack around the class, we need to fix the underlying issue).

The easiest way to replicate is to set: 

CLASSAD_USER_PYTHON_MODULES=test_module
SHADOW=$(SHADOW)_valgrind

(test_module can be invalid - just has to be non-empty to get libclassad_python_user.so to be loaded) where $(SHADOW)_valgrind is: 

#!/bin/sh

exec valgrind /home/cse496/bbockelm/projects/condor-build-ninja/release_dir/sbin/condor_shadow "$@" 2>> /tmp/shadow_valgrind_err

This goes away if the condor_shadow is linked against condor_utils instead of condor_utils_s. This also goes away if _exit is called instead of exit (skipping the finalizers); I think that makes it a regression in 8.3.5.
remarks:
2015-Apr-09 22:11:24 by bbockelm:
It looks like dlopen in src/classad/fnCall.cpp uses the flags RTLD_LAZY|RTLD_GLOBAL.

  • I'm not sure of the value of RTLD_GLOBAL. That indicates the dynamic symbols of the library become global to the daemon. I don't think this is the problem though.
  • If we use the RTLD_DEEPBIND flag, the library will use its own version of the symbols in libcondor_utils.so instead of the one in the shadow. Thus, when the library unloads, it calls the destructors on its own copies of the objects and the crash goes away.
    • This is marked as non-POSIX by the manpage, but appears to be present in both Linux and Mac.

2015-Apr-09 22:22:41 by bbockelm:
Note: Doh! Commit message for branch references wrong ticket. Fix before merge!

2015-Apr-10 09:43:36 by bbockelm:
Hm - as I suspected, RTLD_DEEPBIND isn't available outside Linux (Mac or Solaris builds failed).

Can we simply not run finalizers for those platforms (switch to _exit?)?

2015-Apr-13 15:45:34 by tim:
Unreleased issue, no version history required.
